quiz.question: Which demographic term measures the ratio of dependents to working-age population?
What demographic metric indicates children under age 5 dying per 1,000 live births?
Which population concept counts people who usually reside in a country regardless of citizenship?
What demographic transition stage features falling death rates and high birth rates leading to rapid growth?
Which large country experienced a pronounced gender imbalance at birth in the late 20th century due to sex-selective practices?
What term describes the number of births per 1,000 people per year?
Which country conducted the first modern national census in 1801?
Which country had the highest recorded population growth rate during the mid-20th century due to postwar baby boom?
Which country saw rapid population growth in the 20th century due to industrialization and health improvements?
Which statistic measures the average number of years a newborn is expected to live under current mortality rates?
Which index measures the concentration of population in urban areas relative to rural areas globally?
Which demographic indicator commonly declines as countries develop economically?
Which Asian country implemented a one-child policy from 1979 to 2015?
Which measurement combines fertility, mortality, and migration to project population structures over time?
